page.title: 11Life of a Marine Recruit.
page.content: The day begins at 6am.After breakfast sick parade is held followed by drill, lessons on subjects like map skills,P.T in the gym and weapon training.Lunch is at 12.35,then they may go to Woodbury Common to learn the use of guns of all types and field combat.Larger exercises take place on Dartmoor.The day is hard and organised with frequent endurance tests to be passed at each stage;for example,a Tarzan course across some apparatus,and a climb up a 30ft rope whilst wearing full kit weighing 40lb. After 16.30,their time is their own but there is kit to be looked after and dormitories which are shared between 5 people to be kept clean.The aim is to gain the green beret and to pass out at the Kings Squad Parade,a well earned reward after a hard 10 weeks.
